result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald G Merritt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, BY 06-01-2017. Cash bail to apply.  Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.

Consecutive to: To any other sentence; From 01-25-2016 to 03-21-2016 release for The Day Reporting Center (if eligible) and inmate work assignments within the House of Corrections. From 03-22-2016 to 08-31-2016 release for The Day Reporting Center, inmate work assignments within the House of Corrections and verified work in the community, From 09-01-2016 to completion of sentence,  release for The Day Reporting Center, inmate work assignments within the House of Corrections, verified work in the community, and school; with credit for 60 days (3-31-2015 to 04-07-2015 and 09-02-2015 to 10-23-2015) time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.

Consecutive to: To any other sentence; From 01-25-2016 to 03-21-2016 release for The Day Reporting Center (if eligible) and inmate work assignments within the House of Corrections. From 03-22-2016 to 08-31-2016 release for The Day Reporting Center, inmate work assignments within the House of Corrections and verified work in the community, From 09-01-2016 to completion of sentence,  release for The Day Reporting Center, inmate work assignments within the House of Corrections, verified work in the community, and school; with credit for 0 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.
Consecutive to: To any other sentence, with credit for 19 days (01-07-2016 to 01-25-2016) time served.

*Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison.

miscConds.notes:
*Fine is set at ZERO.
*Drivers license suspension is not imposed.
*Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
*Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, BY 06-01-2017. Cash bail to apply.  Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.
*Maintain fulltime employment/school or a combination of both.

*No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
*Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept.

*No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
*Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $300.00 at one time.
*No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
*Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time. 
*Defendant may not be in a stolen automobile.  
*Defendant may not be in any automobile where a firearm is present. 
*Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate. 
*No contact with Jhrarrel F. (DOB 10-13-1995).
*No contact with Kaine T. (DOB 12-18-1995).
*No contact with Devine B. (DOB 8-16-1993).
*No contact with Dwaine S. (DOB 01-18-1996).
*Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.

*Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
*Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
*Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.

Defendant Donald G Merritt in court with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  Defendant Donald G Merritt in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.

AS TO COUNT 1 -
Court ordered defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence; From 01-25-2016 to 03-21-2016 release for The Day Reporting Center (if eligible) and inmate work assignments within the House of Corrections. From 03-22-2016 to 08-31-2016 release for The Day Reporting Center, inmate work assignments within the House of Corrections and verified work in the community, From 09-01-2016 to completion of sentence,  release for The Day Reporting Center, inmate work assignments within the House of Corrections, verified work in the community, and school; with credit for 60 days (3-31-2015 to 04-07-2015 and 09-02-2015 to 10-23-2015) time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 

AS TO COUNT 2 -
Court ordered defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence; From 01-25-2016 to 03-21-2016 release for The Day Reporting Center (if eligible) and inmate work assignments within the House of Corrections. From 03-22-2016 to 08-31-2016 release for The Day Reporting Center, inmate work assignments within the House of Corrections and verified work in the community, From 09-01-2016 to completion of sentence,  release for The Day Reporting Center, inmate work assignments within the House of Corrections, verified work in the community, and school; with credit for 0 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.

AS TO COUNT 3 -
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS and 6 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 19 days (01-07-2016 to 01-25-2016) time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 12 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 MONTHS.  

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE in COUNT 3 and placed defendant on probation for 3 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AND CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $300.00 at one time.
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
- Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
- Defendant may not be in a stolen automobile.  
- Defendant may not be in any automobile where a firearm is present. 
- Maintain fulltime employment/school or a combination of both. 
- Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate. 
- No contact with Jhrarrel F. (DOB 10-13-1995).
- No contact with Kaine T. (DOB 12-18-1995).
- No contact with Devine B. (DOB 8-16-1993).
- No contact with Dwaine S. (DOB 01-18-1996).
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Drivers license suspension is not imposed.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, BY 06-01-2017. Cash bail to apply.  Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m) or (4m).

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Donald G Merritt in court with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  Defendant Donald G Merritt in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Margaret P., Eric A., and Aisha R.
Case passed until 1:30 pm, due to the time of day.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Exhibit List- Jury Trial received and filed. tk

Verdict, signed, received and filed. tk 
" We, the jury, find the defendant, Donald G. Merritt, guilty of carrying a concealed weaponm as charged in the information."

Defendant Donald G Merritt in court with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  Defendant Donald G Merritt in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Jury trial proceeded. Jury continued deliberating.
At the hour of 9:48 am the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of guilty which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction. Case set for sentencing hearing on 01-25-2016 at 8:30 am, branch 17. Defendant remains REMANDED as to Count 3.
Jury Question, received and filed

Defendant Donald G Merritt in court with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  Defendant Donald G Merritt in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Jury trial proceeded.
State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Jury out of box.  Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.
Jury in the box at 1:25 pm. Placed on the record. State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 2:08 pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Klatkiewicz and Worzola who were duly sworn for that purpose.  
Jury question received and filed. 
Case recalled. Jury in the box at 4:38 pm. Court instructed the jury and released for the evening, to return at 9:00. Jury out of the box.

Defendant Donald G Merritt in court with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  Defendant Donald G Merritt in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Jury trial proceeded.
Jury in the box at 9:27 am. Sworn for the State: Officer Josephe Boehlke, Milwaukee Police Department. Sworn for the State: Forensic Investigator Chet St. Clair, City of Milwaukee. Sworn for the State: Cheif Lantent Print Examiner, Douglas Knueppel, Milwaukee Police Department.  Exhibits 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9 received. Court instructed the jury and released for break. Jury out of the box at 10:45 am. State rests subject to rebuttal. Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court. Upon questioning, Court finds the defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently waives his right to remain silent.
Jury in the box at 11:10 am.   Sworn for defense: Donald Merritt.  Defense rests.  Court instructed the jury and released for the lunch hour. Jury of the box at 11:44 am.
1 page document marked as Exhibit A received and filed. tk

Side bar requested. Court instructed the jury and released for the evening and to return to jury management at 9:00 am. Jury out of the box at 4:20 pm. Side bar placed on the record.

Defendant Donald G Merritt in court with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
In chamber discussion. Case recalled. Parties have reached a partial resolution in this matter. Defense counsel request count 1 set for jury trial. Court will not accept any negotiations or change of plea as to count 1 after today's date. Court ruled on prior convictions. Case proceeded to a plea hearing.

AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3 :

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Case adjourned for final pretrial on 01-07-2015 at 8:30 am and jury trial 01-20-2015 at 9:00 as to count 1, branch 17. Sentencing hearing will be schedule after conclusion of jury trial.

Court REITERATED bail conditions and defendant is to have no violations of any of the conditions of bail.   Court addresses the Justice Point received and notes Defendant continues to comply. 

Parties to have any written stipulations submitted to the court no later than 01-07-2015 at 9:00 am.
